page.title: 04The School Cross Country Run
page.content: Every year since 1980, thirty boys and thirty girls aged 10 or 11 years go to{Linford Bottom}for the annual{ {Ringwood Junior School}cross country run. We run over grassy land between trees and there are lots of ditches to jump over. The course is marked by flags which you have to keep on your right as you run. Towards the end the boys splash through a stream. Someone signals the start with a gun and there are marshalls around the course to help the runners. At the finish runners are handed numbered cards to indicate in which position they finish and they gain points for their House at school. Trophies are presented to the winning boy and girl. We all go home by coach or with our parents feeling hot and tired. The run is good fun.
